new_signals.title: AI Policy Expert Predictions for 2026
new_signals.summary: 2026 will be the year of enforcement and red lines in AI regulation, not just new declarations. Children have died from AI chatbot interactions, demanding proactive prevention. Federal-state tension as Trump's executive order challenges state AI laws. AI described as history's largest speculative bubble with data center electricity demands threatening utility costs.

new_signals.title: CES 2026: Physical AI Robots Replace Dancing Robots
new_signals.summary: CES 2026 marked dramatic shift from entertainment robots to practical working machines. Robots now carry loads, fold laundry, prepare coffee. Physical AI identified as third cost revolution after internet and generative AI, reducing marginal cost of physical labor toward zero. Critical for South Korea given demographic decline.

new_signals.title: UN WESP 2026: Global Economic Growth to Slow Amid Trade Tensions
new_signals.summary: Global economic output forecast to grow 2.7% in 2026, below 2.8% in 2025 and well below pre-pandemic 3.2%. US tariff rate rose from 2.4% (end 2024) to 16.8% (Nov 2025). New tariff regime will reduce global GDP by 0.7% and US GDP by 1.2% by 2026. US-China trade down 35% from year ago.

new_signals.title: IBM Declares 2026 Quantum Advantage Milestone at CES
new_signals.summary: IBM publicly stated 2026 will mark first time quantum computer outperforms classical computer. Ford Otosan reduced 1,000-vehicle scheduling from 30 minutes to under 5 minutes using D-Wave hybrid quantum solver. BASF cut production scheduling from 10 hours to 5 seconds. D-Wave acquired Quantum Circuits Inc. for $550M to accelerate dual-rail system launch in 2026.

new_signals.title: Andreessen Horowitz Raises $15B+ for AI and Strategic Technologies
new_signals.summary: Andreessen Horowitz raised over $15 billion across five new venture funds, one of the sector's largest fundraising efforts amid accelerating AI adoption. Represents major capital commitment to AI and strategic technologies.

new_signals.title: DeepSeek's Breakthrough AI Training Method for 2026
new_signals.summary: DeepSeek published paper outlining Manifold-Constrained Hyper-Connections framework to improve AI scalability while reducing computational and energy demands. Analysts call it a 'striking breakthrough' for the industry. Chinese AI firm competing with OpenAI despite limited access to Nvidia chips.

new_signals.title: Gen Z Job Mobility Reaches Record High - 57% Plan Job Changes in 2026
new_signals.summary: 57% of US Gen Z workers plan to change jobs in 2026, with pay and career growth as top priorities. Gen Z expected to account for 27% of workforce by 2026. Average job tenure in first five years is just 1.1 years. 83% identify as job-hoppers. 77% prioritize work-life balance. 70% say mental health needs most attention.

new_signals.title: Gen Z Embraces 'Year of the Analog' - Intentional Living Movement
new_signals.summary: 2026 represents the 'Year of the Analog' for Gen Z - less about looking back and more about slowing down. Clear desire for experiences that feel tactile, intentional and real. Many rediscovering analog habits like handwriting letters. Gen Z emphasizes authenticity, intentionality over digital stimulation. Major theme is intentional living and emotional grounding.

new_signals.title: Vogue Korea: 6 Wellness Trends Leading 2026
new_signals.summary: Six major wellness trends for 2026: 1) Workplace wellness becomes essential (30% higher stress resilience for leaders prioritizing health), 2) AI meets ancient wisdom (DNA testing + sleep trackers), 3) Contrast therapy/bio-hacking goes mainstream (sauna market to grow from $1.2B to $3.5B by 2035), 4) Power of breath (Pranayama techniques), 5) Digital detox with Faraday bags, 6) Longevity with soul (spiritual practitioners show 33% higher longevity rates).

new_signals.title: Sound Healing and Vagus Nerve Stimulation Lead 2026 Wellness Tech
new_signals.summary: Sound healing using chimes, gongs and crystal bowls becoming increasingly popular in mainstream settings like David Lloyd and Virgin Active. Vagus nerve becomes key focus with neuroscience-engineered wearables (Sona, Yōjō) potentially becoming next trillion-pound health industry. VR healthcare market forecast to grow 30% per year through 2030 with immersive meditation and virtual spas.

new_signals.title: Trump Tariffs Impact: Korea Economic Growth Slows to 1.8% in 2026
new_signals.summary: UN warns Trump tariff impacts will become more evident in 2026. Korea's economic growth rate projected at 1.8% for 2026, 2.0% for 2027. In January 2026, US Commerce Department issued preliminary dumping determination on Korean chemical products (monomers, oligomers). Global trade system restructuring rather than collapsing after 9 months of Trump's trade war.

new_signals.title: CES 2026: Nvidia Rubin Architecture to Replace Blackwell in H2 2026
new_signals.summary: Nvidia's Rubin computing architecture set to begin replacing Blackwell in second half of 2026 to meet increasing AI computation demands. Nvidia showcased Alpamayo family of open source AI models and tools for autonomous vehicles. Razer's Project AVA evolved into 5.5-inch animated holographic desk companion. Clicks Technology debuts $499 Communicator phone with physical keyboard.

new_signals.title: Samsung and LG Unveil Micro RGB TV Technology at CES 2026
new_signals.summary: Micro RGB emerged as most talked-about TV development at CES 2026. Samsung showcased 130-inch Micro RGB concept TV and announced sizes from 55 to 115 inches. Samsung Display revealed next-gen QD-OLED panels with up to 4,500 nits peak brightness. LG's OLED evo W6 Wallpaper TV features 9mm thick panel with Zero Connect Box delivering wireless video up to 10 meters. LG's G6 flagship 20% brighter than G5, world's first 120Hz cloud gaming TV.

new_signals.title: EU Electrification Action Plan to Counter China's Pace
new_signals.summary: EU's Electrification Action Plan will be key pillar to increase industrial leadership as China's pace of electrification shows steady growth while EU's path is stagnating. Clean technologies expected to continue dominating new energy deployments in 2026. Industry transition and clean investments are key as EU shapes post-2030 climate policy.

new_signals.title: US Crypto Regulation 2026: CLARITY Act Senate Markup in January
new_signals.summary: Senate committee markups for CLARITY Act scheduled for January 2026, representing critical milestone for crypto market structure legislation. House passed bill in July 2025 with strong bipartisan support. GENIUS Act created federal framework for payment stablecoins, with regulators expected to finalize licensing, custody, capital, and compliance requirements by mid-2026. CFTC to wrap up crypto sprint by August 2026.

new_signals.title: AI Healthcare Transitions from Hype to Reality in 2026
new_signals.summary: Medical AI transitions from hype to reality in 2026, with real-world evidence exposing bias and workflow fit issues. 2026 predicted to mark year AI moves beyond hype to become integrated and measurable driver of personalized cancer care. CRISPR-GPT can design experiments in months rather than years. First fully personalized CRISPR treatment administered to six-year-old child in mid-2025, momentum continues into 2026.

new_signals.title: Biotech Breakthroughs 2026: Organ Regeneration and De Novo Protein Design
new_signals.summary: 2026 could bring exciting biotech breakthroughs including organ regeneration with scientists working on growing new organs using patient's own cells. Advances in de novo protein design expected to produce enzymes with functions that don't exist in nature, leading to breakthroughs in sustainable chemistry, medicine, and materials science. Microfluidic technologies able to conduct multiple complex tests on single drop of blood.

new_signals.title: MZ Generation Labor Market: Rising 'Resting' Population Reaches 5.6%
new_signals.summary: 'Resting' population increased from 3.2% (123만 명) in 2005 to 5.6% (254만 명) in 2025 of working-age population. Labor market dual structure deepening: excessive competition for quality jobs in large companies/public institutions vs. shortage in SMEs/difficult jobs. Some MZ generation experiencing delayed employment or giving up, remaining in career interruption/job abandonment state. New job categories emerging: pet sitters, pet trainers, pet funeral directors.

new_signals.title: arXiv January 2026: Energy-Aware Routing and AI Explanation Trust
new_signals.summary: Recent arXiv AI papers include 'Energy-Aware Routing to Large Reasoning Models' submitted to ACL Rolling Review January 2026. Paper on 'Can We Trust AI Explanations? Evidence of Systematic Underreporting in Chain-of-Thought Reasoning' addresses AI transparency issues. 'Bio-inspired Agentic Self-healing Framework for Resilient Distributed Computing Continuum Systems' explores resilient AI systems. Research spans LLM conversations, multimodal HCI frameworks for BCI feedback, and self-correction in LLMs.

new_signals.title: Trump Administration Federal-State AI Regulation Conflict Intensifies
new_signals.summary: President Trump signed executive order December 11, 2025 casting doubt on enforceability of state AI laws, proposing uniform Federal policy framework that preempts inconsistent state laws. Executive Order directs Attorney General to establish AI litigation task force to challenge state AI laws. Sets up major constitutional confrontation over federalism and AI regulation. New state AI laws effective January 1, 2026 face immediate legal challenges.

new_signals.title: US-Europe AI Regulatory Collision: EU AI Act vs. Trump Light-Touch Approach
new_signals.summary: EU AI Act appears set to collide with Trump administration focused on light-touch regulation. Trump administration posturing to defend American companies against regulation using negotiating powers. As Chinese ambitions toward Taiwan intensify, Congress may be forced in 2026 to reconsider longstanding resistance to federal preemption of state AI regulations. Rhetoric around AI's necessity to national security and geopolitics will crank up.

new_signals.title: China ESG Compliance: 2025 Review and 2026 Outlook
new_signals.summary: Chinese companies preparing to publish 2025 sustainability reports by April 30, 2026 deadline. In-scope entities in Australia, Hong Kong, Malaysia, and Singapore scheduled to issue first ISSB-aligned reports in 2026. From 2026 onwards, UK will begin phasing in UK Sustainability Reporting Standards (UK SRS), an ISSB-aligned framework. Regulatory landscape companies face in 2026 looks different than in 2025.

new_signals.title: Women's Cardiovascular Health Risk Assessment Advances in 2026
new_signals.summary: By 2026, experts predict ability to characterize women's cardiovascular risk with more biological precision, with early trials incorporating reproductive history and menopause status into risk stratification. Real breakthrough expected in mental health services with better data utilization and integrated care leading to faster access to better-suited treatments.

new_signals.title: Space Force Expands West Coast Heavy Launch Capabilities
new_signals.summary: US Space Force looking to expand West Coast heavy launch capabilities in 2026. ISRO launching EOS-N1 radar imaging satellite January 11 at 11:47 PM EST from Satish Dhawan Space Centre on PSLV-XL rocket carrying 18 rideshare payloads. Isar Aerospace's Spectrum rocket scheduled to launch several cubesats from ESA's Boost program on January 16 from Andøya Spaceport in Norway.

filtering_summary.notes: 신규 신호 추출 시 보수적인 기준을 적용하여 엔터티 중복도가 낮은 신호도 신규로 판단. 기존 신호 DB의 158개 신호와 비교했으며, 동일 주제의 심화 보도나 지역별 관점의 다른 신호는 신규로 분류.
